abstract: Internal Revenue Service denies tax-exempt status for unnamed accountable care organization, dealing blow to new type of health care network promoted by Obama administration; says organization does not qualify for status because it is not operated exclusively as charity.
lead_paragraph: The agency said an accountable care organization did not meet the test for tax-exempt status because it was not operated exclusively for charitable purposes.

headline.main: I.R.S. Ruling Is Obstacle to Health Care Networks Promoted by Obama
headline.print_headline: I.R.S. Ruling Is Potential Obstacle to Health Care Networks Promoted by Obama

snippet: The agency said an accountable care organization did not meet the test for tax-exempt status because it was not operated exclusively for charitable purposes.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
